summary: An out-of-state grower of carrots that also makes “baby” carrots from whole carrots, and sells such baby carrots, protests the assessment of B&O tax on such sales. Taxpayer argues that (1) it is entitled to “dissociate” its sales of baby carrots to customers in Washington, (2) the baby carrots were received by customers outside of Washington, and (3) Taxpayer’s sales of baby carrots are exempt from B&O tax because Taxpayer is a farmer. We deny Taxpayer’s petition . . . .
